fields.description:
While using the "Add to Issue" feature we currently timeout the call to the Jira's endpoint to 2 seconds and return an empty list of options. 

In such cases, it would be impossible for a user to add a message to an issue in the modal because the dropdown component requires the user to select an item from the list.

h3 Suggested resolution
In the autocomplete field, when the users types an issue key, we could check if the issue exists and the user has access to it, if that it's true then we can allow them to add the message to this ticket.
fields.summary: Allow selecting an issue by its key in the Add to Issue modal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Jira Cloud Excel app, you're only able to see your own filters, even if you have other filters shared with your user/group/project. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an Excel workspace connected to a Jira Instance using the Add-in
 # Try to select a filter created by another user that is shared with you in that instance

h3. Expected Results

It's expected you should see all filters shared with you in that instance.
h3. Actual Results

You're only able to see your own filters, this prevents you from sharing filters with other users that want to update the Excel workbook.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Excel app seems to filter out JQL filters which it shouldn't filter out

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While using the Official [Slack integration|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-work-management/docs/integrate-jira-cloud-and-slack/#JiraCloudforSlack-UseslashcommandsintheJiraCloudSlackapp] it would be nice to have the option to select a text in Slack channel and from there add that it a comment to an existing ticket.

h3. Use case
Users would select a sentence > right click and then choose to add this to the ticket.
fields.summary: Add the ability to select a text in a Slack Channel and add that to a Jira ticket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Exporting search results with a high number of fields to Excel will often result in errors and timeouts.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a search that returns a high number of issues (~1k tickets should work)
 # Add multiple columns to the search results. If possible, add SLA fields, as they seem to have a higher impact.
# Export the results by clicking on "Open on Microsoft Excel".  
!image-2021-10-19-09-41-17-839.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The query results will open on Excel or the file will be successfully downloaded.

h3. Actual Results

An error will happen:  
!image-2021-10-19-09-42-31-770.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

* Use the "Open in Google sheets" instead. (The bug doesn't seem to affect the Google sheets export)
* Export fewer fields and combine the two files later.
** Example: Export the *Issue Key* and the *SLA* fields apart from the rest of the fields.
fields.summary: Timeout errors when exporting search results to Excel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Excel icon on the top right hand corner in the Advanced Search or Filter, to open the data which was retrieved in Excel does not handle more than 1000 issues.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Advanced search or Filter 
 # Retrieve around 7000 issues
 # Click on the Excel icon on the top right-hand corner

h3. Expected Results

To able to open over 7000 issues in excel

h3. Actual Results

504 Gateway Time-out

Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 504 ()

 !Screen Shot 2021-09-15 at 11.24.35 am.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

[Jira Cloud for Google Sheets|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220382/jira-cloud-for-google-sheets-official?tab=overview&hosting=cloud] or [Jira Cloud for Excel|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221301/jira-cloud-for-excel-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview], but the limit still is 5000 issues at a time.
fields.summary: The Excel icon on the top right hand corner in the Advanced Search or Filter, to open the data which was retrieved in Excel does not handle more than 1000 issues.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Microsoft Teams plugin app is not a verified Publisher because as per the Microsoft Document: [Mark your app as publisher verified|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/mark-app-as-publisher-verified] it is mentioned as:
 # Ensure the app’s publisher domain is set.
 # Ensure that either the publisher domain or a DNS-verified custom domain on the tenant matches the domain of the email address used during the verification process for your MPN account.

 
When we run *_whois_* *_[msteams-atlassian.com|http://msteams-atlassian.com/]_* command we can see that the Domain Registrant is still “SoftServe” not “Atlassian”.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Run query: _whois msteams-atlassian.com_

For example: Observe the Registrant Organization when you query: *_[msteams-atlassian.com|http://msteams-atlassian.com/]_*

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Existing labels not getting listed while creating an issue from MS Teams application, prompting to create a new label instead.
Issue noticed if we have more than 30 + labels created in Jira. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the plugin *Microsoft Teams for Jira Server* (v  *2021.07.57*) on Jira server v *8.13.6* (I have tested with 8.13.6 only)
 # Create an application link to MS teams
 # Create labels in Jira. Try to create 30 + labels. 
 # Access MS Teams and create a new issue from the MS teams application.
 # Go to the *Label* field and click on the dropdown.
 # Search for the existing labels in Jira.

h3. Expected Results

All the existing labels should get listed in the *Labels* field while creating an issue from MS Teams.
h3. Actual Results

All the available labels are not getting listed in the field.
 For example, Label named as *1* is available in Jira. Following the screenshot captured from the DB table *label,* where we can see the label entry *1*.
 !Screenshot 2021-10-14 at 3.20.30 PM.png!

But it's missing when we try to search for labels and it's prompting us to create a new label.
 !Screenshot 2021-10-14 at 3.16.48 PM.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Existing labels not getting listed while creating an issue from MS Teams application.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
According to our [marketplace page|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217836/microsoft-teams-for-jira?tab=overview&hosting=datacenter] for Microsoft Teams for Jira, the latest available version we have for this plugin (2021.07.57) is compatible with Jira Server/Data Center 7.0.0 - 8.18.2. With that said, customers that upgraded Jira to 8.19.x  cannot install this app from Atlassian's Marketplace.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a Microsoft Teams for Jira version which can be used with Jira Server/Data Center 8.19.x.
fields.summary: Add a Microsoft Teams for Jira plugin version compatible with Jira 8.19.x

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When using the Open in Excel option, users are able to download an excel file.  However when opening that file in Excel, there exists an about sheet that contains a rather large image.  This image
- it increases the file size
- it negatively affects the preview when reattaching the export in a ticket
- it confuses users

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove this image from the about sheet

h3. Why this is important
Improve usage of end users.
Simplifies visual look.
fields.summary: When exporting issues to Excel, there should not be a large image in the About worksheet

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to import some number of issues (e.g. 5000), it doesn't work and results in "Oops... Something went wrong. Try importing again" error. Lowering the issue limit to 2500 resolve the problem
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Excel and Jira Cloud for Excel add-in.
 # Go to "Fields" tab and select fields which can contain a lot of text data.
 # Set maximum issues to 5000 (in some cases the limit might be higher or lower, depends on the issue data volume).
 # Click "Refresh data" and observe the error.

h3. Expected Results

All issues are imported.
h3. Actual Results

It doesn't import all issues.
h3. Workaround

There are two options:
 * Find the "Max rows" value that works and use it
 * Deselect fields in the "Fields" tab which potentially can contain a lot of text data (e.g. description).
fields.summary: Importing issue in Excel results in error and never finish

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an issue in MSTeams, the 'Original Estimate' and 'Remaining Estimate' fields are missing in the dialog even if they are added to the create issue screen in Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Jira with MSTeams as explained in [Microsoft Teams for Jira Server documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/msteamsjiraserver/microsoft-teams-for-jira-server-documentation-1027116656.html]
 # Make sure to add the 'Time Tracking' field to the issue create screen in Jira.
 # Go to MSTeams and type the 'create' command to create an issue.

h3. Expected Results

You should see the 'Original Estimate' and 'Remaining Estimate' fields in the issue create dialog in MSTeams.
h3. Actual Results

The 'Original Estimate' and 'Remaining Estimate' fields are missing in MSTeams dialog.
h3. Workaround

Set the time tracking fields in Jira interface.
fields.summary: Time Tracking fields missing in the issue create dialog in MSTeams

fields.description:
When setting up the slack integration it has been found, that there are no notifications for priority updates. 
Please implement the option to enable notifications for priority changes
fields.summary: Slack notifications for priority updates

fields.description:
Request Types with any required field other than Summary and Description don't appear as options in the Jira Cloud for Outlook app.

h3. Suggestion
Make it possible to select Request Types with multiple required fields and set those fields while creating a ticket.
fields.summary: Ability to select Request Types that have required fields in Jira Cloud for Outlook app
Slack notifications exclude MY own actions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The error "This app returned an error. Please try again, or contact the app's developer." appears when trying to select an issue type in the ticket's creation popup in Slack.

This happens because there are too many fields visible for the default issue type selected. The error persists even when changing to issue types with fewer fields.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Having an issue type with a large number of fields, create a ticket in Slack using /jira create
 # Try changing the Issue Type and the error message is seen.

h3. Expected Results
The Issue Type and the form loads correctly.

h3. Actual Results
Error message is shown and the ticket cannot be created.

h3. Workaround
* Try removing visible fields from the default issue type and retrying the ticket creation process.
fields.summary: When choosing the issue type during the creation of a ticket in Slack, an error occurs.

fields.description: Currently when responding to a service desk issue via slack we seem restricted to only commenting publicly.  This is sufficient most times, but for a small subset of times there's a need to make an internal comment to share sensitive information that the reporter or participants shouldn't be aware of.
fields.summary: Add Ability to designate comments as Internal from Slack

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When there are custom fields with the same name used in the different Team-managed projects then you cannot export them from the issue navigator to an Excel sheet. They will appear blank in the sheet.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create one or custom fields in different team-managed projects with the same name
 # Fill value for these custom fields in a couple of issues of the different team-managed projects
 # Now search for these issues in the Issue Navigator
 # You will be able to see the values for custom fields, now click on the Export to Excel (CSV) button to export it
 # You would see that value would not appear for all the fields in the excel sheet. Check the video attached below. 

h3. Expected Results

As the values are shown in Issue Navigator, hence they should be visible in the export as well. Check video replication here: [^export of custom field from Team Managed project.mov]
h3. Actual Results

Values are not exported in excel sheet for these custom fields
h3. Workaround

Create the custom fields with different names in the team-managed projects
fields.summary: custom fields with the same name used in the different Team-managed projects cannot be exported correctly

fields.description: API-2 failed to solve the problem and the API configuration of Jira does not allow for reopening or declining the solution. The need is to reflect priority changes only to slack. This allows for creating an escalation channel. Ideally I'd like to be able to choose the priority level. So I want reflected any changes to/from a P0 priority. I understand this seems like a very specific request, but every development organization has the notion of escalations and integrating those with slack is a very useful workflow. Some limited version of this can be achieved with Jira workflow using transitions and status, but it disrupts normal workflow status.
fields.summary: Send slack notification for specific priority changes only

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Jira Cloud for Outlook, currently the Attached emails cannot be downloaded from Jira tickets, It would be great to have the actual email file available that can be downloaded.
fields.summary: Using Jira Cloud for Outlook I'd like to attach email as a file, so later users can download it and reply to it

fields.description:
In Jira issue create screen when setting the versions field (Fix version/s, Affect version/s), the field is displayed and grouped by released and unreleased versions. In MSTeams create issue dialog, it is not following this grouping and just sorted based on the release date. It would be good to follow the same display as in Jira.

From Jira Create Issue Screen:
 !Screenshot 2021-08-23 at 10.55.39.png|thumbnail! 
 

From MSTeam Issue Create Dialog:
 !Screenshot 2021-08-23 at 10.32.45.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: MSTeams - Improve the display of versions field in issue Create Dialog

fields.description:
When you search or see issues in MS teams only Story, Task, Bug, subtasks and Epic default icons are compatible, all other icons including custom ones are not shown and a generic grey icon is shown instead.
 !image-2021-08-18-18-15-45-364.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: MS teams: add support to all issue type icons including custom ones

fields.description:
Right now every Jira project needs to be connected individually with CRM.

It would be very helpful if there was a global integration so that one Jira system can be connected with one CRM system. In this case only one set-up would be needed and not for each project individually.
fields.summary: Global Connection for CRM integration

fields.description: Admins would benefit from having the option to disable the capability for users to invite other users to Jira from Slack.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict user invites to Jira from Slack

fields.description:
Right now we have following case:
 * The contact information of the person which is reporter and/or assignee is shown on a Jira issue.
 * As for us the assignee and/or reporter never will be a customer but only an internal employee, we always need to connect a customer manually on each Jira issue.

Our wish would be that there is an additional option:
 * A Jira project can be connected with one customer/company within CRM
 * In this case the customer/company is shown on each Jira issue within this project. So no manual connection needs to be created.
fields.summary: Connect Customer with Jira project

fields.description:
We are using the Jira Cloud for CRM with CRM Dynamics from Microsoft.

If a contact is connected with a Jira issue, phone number and E-Mail address are shown, but it is not possible to use the contact information directly (for example by clicking on the phone number or E-Mail and Outlook or Teams is opened).

It would be very helpful if this feature could be added to the CRM integration.
fields.summary: Ability to use phone numbers and E-Mail addresses that are shown by CRM integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Cloud for Sheets might fail with the error *Hmmm ... looks like we stumbled a bit, please try again or contact Atlassian support if the issue persists. (§GS-404)*.

That happens because the integration is unable to find the target sheet.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

There are no clear steps that could lead to replicating that problem that have been identified yet.

h3. Expected Results

The integration will be able to load content on the sheet.

h3. Actual Results

The integration simply fails to load content on the target sheet.

h3. Workaround

Recreating the affected sheet normally resolves the problem.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Sheets integration fails with error GS-404

fields.description:
When creating issues or making comments from Slack, it would be helpful to @mention a Slack user and have their corresponding Jira user receive a mention.

It's currently possible to use user pickers (example: Assignee). This suggestion would be for @mentioning users in free-text fields like Description or a comment body.
fields.summary: Mention Jira users from Slack

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sprint field does not fetch all the results from Microsoft Teams App
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Teams app and try creating a new issue.
 # If you have huge list of sprints on your site, only few Sprints shows up but all the sprints will not be visible

h3. Expected Results

Searching for the respective Sprint should be visible.
h3. Actual Results

Searching for the Sprint shows empty results as the Teams app is unable to fetch it.
h3. Workaround

Currently, Adding the sprint to the ticket from the web app version is the only go as of now.
fields.summary: Sprint field does not fetch all the results from Microsoft Teams App

fields.description:
{panel:title= Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Both apps don't disclose which endpoint they need access to be fully functioning.

Currently, they only state:
 * [https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/office/WA200003113?tab=Overview]
 * [https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/office/wa200002140?tab=overview]

{quote}This add-in can access personal information on the active message, such as phone numbers, postal addresses, or URLs. The add-in may send this data to a third-party service. Other items in your mailbox can’t be read or modified.
{quote}
The message in the install flow is vague:

!teams.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

For the sake of exercising the zero-trust security model, provide information about the required access, such as per APIs, so that the admins can control access in a more granular manner.
h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Break down required access for Microsoft Teams apps

fields.description:
I've seen that development is in progress.
Would you have any ETA for this?
fields.summary: ProForma intergration with Insight

fields.description:
There is no documented field: Days in Status field. There are several posts in Jira Community about that people are trying to figure out the information provided and how to parse it. Especially the duration on each status is not clear what this information means. People assume it is time in seconds, but the information returned is not consistent (possible bug).

Here is one of the posts:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Jira-Cloud-for-Google-Sheets-Add-ons-Days-in-Status-field/qaq-p/1737252#M490454]

Thanks,

David
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Google Sheets: Document Days in Status Field

fields.description:
A confluence page might be updated numerous times a day/week and it can get noisy.

Can we please support receiving digests for updated pages on optionally daily or weekly basis?
fields.summary: Support "digest" mode for updated pages.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Microsoft Teams integration app currently only supports the en-US language locale. This poses a problem for users of other languages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use Microsoft Teams in with another language (like French);
 # Jira Data Center using French as a primary language;
 # Install [Jira Server for Teams|https://appsource.microsoft.com/en/product/office/WA200002278?tab=DetailsAndSupport] in the Microsoft Teams;
 # Install [Microsoft Teams for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217836/microsoft-teams-for-jira?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview] plugin in Jira;
 # [Jira Server for Teams|https://appsource.microsoft.com/en/product/office/WA200002278?tab=DetailsAndSupport] in the Microsoft Teams shows everything in English.

h3. Expected Results

The Microsoft Team's app has a translation for French (or any other language defined by the user).
h3. Actual Results

Microsoft Team's app only supports the en-US language locale.

!image-2021-07-29-17-50-38-477.png|width=274,height=392!

!image-2021-07-29-17-51-13-492.png!

!image-2021-07-29-17-52-22-312.png|width=860,height=311!

 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Microsoft Teams integration for Jira Server should support user-selected language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the "Create issue from" dialogue in Slack, the "Parent" field is shown for the "Task" issue type. Selecting the dropdown shows no results, even if there are epics in the project. This affects Team Managed (formerly known as next-gen) projects, not Company Managed projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect a Jira instance to Slack
 # Create a Team Managed project
 # Create an Epic in the project 
 # In Slack, use the "Create Issue from" action to create an issue from a message
 # Select the Team Managed project, and "Task" as the issue type

h3. Expected Results

The task is able to be linked to a parent epic from the Create screen in Slack
h3. Actual Results

The "Parent" field shows "No result" when selected
!image-2021-07-29-15-26-39-869.png|width=513,height=130!
h3. Workaround

Create the issue _without_ selecting a Parent Epic / Epic Link in Slack. Once the issue is created and the Jira Cloud app gives you the issue key, open the issue in the Jira interface. Use the "Add parent" action in Jira to add the Task to an Epic.
fields.summary: Create Issue from Slack incorrectly shows Parent field in Team Managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Getting Validation error when trying to create Issues from Outlook signed emails

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Pick any signed email in Outlook 
# Now Send to Issue from the Jira Cloud for Outlook add-on 
# Check Include attachment checkbox or even leave this unchecked
# Hit Send and can see a *Validation error*

 !image-2021-07-21-14-55-07-056.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The email should be linked to the issue same as any unsigned emails.

h3. Actual Results

We see a Validation Error.

h3. Workaround

We can use OWA (Outlook Web App) to send signed emails with/without attachments.
fields.summary: Getting Validation error when trying to create issues from signed emails in Outlook

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user clicks on "Open in Excel" -> "Excel Online" and then selects Microsoft personal account, it redirects to

{noformat}
https://login.live.com/oauth20_authorize.srf?client_id=d760da92-59d3-4459-b6ee-37648ce52e54&scope=files.readwrite+offline_access+user.read&redirect_uri=https%3a%2f%2fjira-spreadsheets.services.atlassian.com%2fv2%2fauth%2fflow&response_type=code&state=reducted
{noformat}

and shows a blank screen (404 HTTP status code).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open issue search page in Jira
 # Click the "Open in Excel" icon and then select "Excel online"
 # Select Microsoft personal account or log in into one

h3. Expected Results
It authorizes successfully and then export Jira issues and opens in Excel Online

h3. Actual Results
It shows a blank page with 404 HTTP status code

h3. Workaround
* Use "Excel Desktop" instead which downloads an Excel file and then users can open it in Excel Online.
* Or use work/school Microsoft account (if it fails immediately, try to open in incognito mode)
fields.summary: Login flow fails while exporting issues with "Open in Excel Online" with personal Microsoft account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Since Friday, the add-in stopped working and is stuck on the loading screen. This issue only happens on older versions of Excel Desktop on Windows.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Install Jira Cloud for Excel and open it in Excel Desktop.

h3. Expected Results
Add-in launches successfully

h3. Actual Results
Add-in is stuck on the loading screen

h3. Workaround
Install the latest version of the Excel Desktop app or use [Excel Online|https://www.office.com/launch/excel].
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Excel add-in is stuck on loading screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JQL export to Google Sheets will result in either of two errors:
1. "State mismatch!"
or
2. "Session cookie not found. Please try again."
for URL https://sheets-jira-production.atl-pi-dev.net/callback/sheets/auth?state=[REDACTED]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From the issue navigator perform an advanced search
# Click on the Google Sheets option
# Go through the OAuth flow as appropriate and grant permission for "Jira Cloud for Sheets"

h3. Expected Results
No errors returned

h3. Actual Results
Initially I was getting a "State mismatch!" error but now am consistently getting the following "Session cookie not found. Please try again." error

h3. Workaround
Use the Export button to export as CSV then import into Google Sheets
fields.summary: Open in Google Sheets results in State mismatch! error or Session cookie not found. Please try again. error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JQL export to Microsoft Excel will result in either:
1. "Desktop" option showing "404 page not found" with URL https://jira-spreadsheets.services.atlassian.com/v2/auth/
or
2. "Online" option showing:
{code}
This login.live.com page can’t be found
No web page was found for the web address: https://login.live.com/oauth20_authorize.srf?client_id=[REDACTED]
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From the issue navigator perform an advanced search
 # Click on the Microsoft Excel option leading to https://jira-spreadsheets.services.atlassian.com/export-to-excel?link=[REDACTED]
# Choose either Desktop or Online option 

h3. Expected Results
- Desktop option generates xlsx (works in some instances)
- Online option asks you to sign into Excel online and succeeds

h3. Actual Results
- 404

h3. Workaround
Use the Export button option to export as CSV then import into Excel desktop or online
fields.summary: Open in Microsoft Excel results in 404 login.live.com page can't be found

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, if a user has language set as Spanish, a notification is sent to Slack using Spanish to describe the issue type. But the recipient user's language is English.
_(This happening for all languages not only Spanish)_
 !Screenshot 2021-07-05 at 15.25.17.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configura Slack on a project
 # Change language to anything other than English
 # Add a comment to an issue
 # Issue type in Slack will be sent in the language set in the user's profile. If the recipient has English it will not be translated 

h3. Expected Results
Slack notification should match the recipient's language

h3. Actual Results
Slack notification does not match the recipient's language

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Slack notification does not match the recipient's language

fields.description:
It would be really cool if the backlog board could have the same view as the active sprint board. There are times where we finish a sprint, but it is hard to visually see the progress of backlog tickets. I know this is a common complain amongst development teams and the backlog view.

Have this view (1st screenshot) with an option that looks like this (2nd screenshot):

!image-2021-07-01-13-49-08-117.png|width=426,height=264!

 

!image-2021-07-01-13-49-45-942.png|width=479,height=104!
fields.summary: Create a board view for backlogs - dev projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an issue is being created from Slack integration, if the create screen contains the Account field from Tempo add-on and an account is selected for this field, the create process fails
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Tempo to your Jira instance.
 # Add some accounts, teams, users and associate them with test project.
 # Go to the test project configuration and enable Tempo there.
 # Add Tempo Account field to issue creation screen.
 # Create issue with “/jira create” command from Slack and select some account in Account field.

h3. Expected Results

issue created
h3. Actual Results

An error is shown during the issue: 
{noformat}
io.tempo.jira__account: Can not deserialize instance of java.lang.Long out of START_OBJECT token at [Source: N/A; line: -1, column: -1]
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating issue with Jira Cloud for Slack fails if adding value to the Account field from Tempo add-on

fields.description: It would be good to have the ability to disable Microsoft Teams for Confluence Cloud app.
fields.summary: Ability to disable Microsoft Teams for Confluence Cloud
Display how many and which users currently have the personal notifications configured within their Jira Account.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When setting notification triggers, having comments unchecked will result in Tasks not being sent if they are configured.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Uncheck: "Comment created", "Comment edited", "Comment replied", "Comment deleted".
 # Check: "Task created", "task updated", "Task resolved", "Task reopened", "Task deleted".
 # Add a task to a pull request
 # Edit a task

h3. Expected Results
Tasks are sent to Slack with a notification.
h3. Actual Results
No notification is sent. Or if comments are configured, it will be sent stating there is a "Comment" rather than a "Task created"


h3. Workaround

Set the corresponding comment notifications in order to receive the notifications
fields.summary: Setting notifications for Tasks in Pull Requests do not work as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you try to create an issue on MS teams using "@Jira Cloud create" and a project has a custom image avatar it shows as a broken link in the MS team creation screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload and update a custom image in one of the project details
 # Try creating an issue in MS teams with "@Jira Cloud create" 
 # https://share.getcloudapp.com/2Nuq0Ezz

h3. Expected Results
The custom images should show correctly

h3. Actual Results
The project shows as a broken link


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom project images show broken when creating an issue on MS teams

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using non-system custom avatars for a custom issue type, Slack cannot use the custom avatar while displaying the notification.

This behavior is caused because user-uploaded avatars are considered private information and they were put behind an authorization wall, thus Slack - that is a third-party provider - cannot access them directly. This restriction was applied in April 2021.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a custom avatar - that does not belong to the system - to an issue type.
 # Setup a subscription with Slack
 # When creating an issue or any notification that is enabled, the notification on Slack does not show the correct avatar.

h3. Expected Results

Slack should show correct avatars for the added custom avatars.
h3. Workaround

Use a system-defined avatar.
fields.summary: Custom issue type avatars are never displayed in notifications on Slack.

fields.description:
Currently, when there is an added and edited page/blog post, upon published, it triggers a notification in Slack channels configured and integrated.

However, for "add pages", it could be also understood that any page added to the space should trigger a notification, such is the case for moved pages, that were "added" to the space.

But this operation does not trigger a notification and this is an expected behavior.

We would like to suggest the implementation of notifications to know when a page and blog posts were moved.
fields.summary: Slack notifications when moving pages and blog posts in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Configuring multiple projects to send notifications to the same room is difficult and error prone when there are many projects in the instance.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Follow the same approach as the *Jira Server Alerts* app (from Slack) where it was possible to configure a single webhook for multiple projects
* Alternatively, allow the bulk configuration of notifications to Slack channels
fields.summary: Bulk configure notification from multiple projects

fields.description:
We have integrated Bitbucket pull request to slack and each comment of the update is being received as individual message and is causing the slack channel to me spammed and not use full if there are new pull request created and needs attention 

We can disable comments but it will defeat the purpose of slack integration

 

It will be great if the messages are posted to slack in a thread model , with 1 thread for each pull request so that it will be easy to follow
fields.summary: Bitbucket pull request slack messages in a thread

fields.description:
There are only a certain number of fields that can be edited in the View issue mode for Outlook.

It would be great to see all the fields that have been configured for the issue type so that, they can be updated in outlook View Issue mode.

The most important of them are the time tracking fields. It adds so much value.
fields.summary: Introduce the ability to edit additional fields especially time tracking in Outlook View Issue

fields.description:
When creating tickets from Outlook emails using the *Jira Cloud for Outlook* add-on creates a field called "Attached emails" that has emails attached to it. 
At the time of External System Import, the email attachments are not seen in the imported issue. Looking at the CSV export the "attached emails" field is not present in the file
fields.summary: Attached emails field from Jira Cloud for Outlook add-on is not exported with CSV Export

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to format text in the JIRA outlook app when creating an issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # While creating an issue in the Jira outlook app, try formating the text content in the description field.

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to find options such as attach files, use numbered lists, bullet lists, text colors, etc.

h3. Actual Results

These options cannot be accessed.  

h3. Workaround
Use the keyboard shortcuts mentioned in our document [here|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/markdown-and-keyboard-shortcuts/].
fields.summary: Unable to format text in the JIRA outlook app when creating an issue.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking "Paste Email Comments" loses line breaks and bullets
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on "Paste Email Comments"

h3. Expected Results

Keep line breaks and bullet points.
h3. Actual Results

Line breaks and bullet points are lost.

Extra line breaks are also inserted and so the user needs to manually remove them.

 
{noformat}
 {noformat}
h3. Workaround

Manually copy/paste from the email.
fields.summary: Clicking "Paste Email Comments" loses line breaks and bullets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a logged out user try to interact with a ticket, the whole ticket item in Slack gets replaced with a login message:
"To perform this action, please authorize Slack & login to your Atlassian account"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Customer re-integrated slack<>Jira
* A Ticket was created and the Slack integration posted it to the channel;
* A user who is logged out (for example: the user had not re-authenticated since the customer re-installed the add-on), clicks ‘Assign’ to assign the issue to themselves.

h3. Expected Results
The user should get a message to log in

h3. Actual Results
Instead of sending them a private message, the entire ticket message is replaced with the login error, meaning that no-one else in the channel could see the ticket that was being discussed anymore

h3. Workaround
user to log in
fields.summary: Slack integration cannot update issue status

fields.description:
Hi,

 

we are using the import for new tickets weekly between the Jira of our customer and ours. 

[https://teamwillbenelux.atlassian.net/secure/BulkCreateSetupPage!default.jspa?externalSystem=com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jim-plugin%3AbulkCreateCsv]

 

Now all our tickets belong to an epic from Jira. we would like to link the imported tickets to them. You can link relating tickets. You can also add the parent ID. But those won't change the epic itself. The parent ID is used for subtaks, which they are not. and the relating link is only relating the epic as a link, not putting it in the correct spot so scrum boards don't apply it.

We want it here:

!image-2021-04-30-10-42-54-780.png!

Should we have the possibility to add the epic id, then I could add ASD-194 for example in my csv and import it as such.

I also tried modifying the config file to do so but it won't accempt my changes.

The field is called <parent id="13491">ASD-194</parent> so maybe it is a quick fix with the current way you can select the parent id. 

 

Thanks for looking into it.
fields.summary: Import epic link onto tickets

fields.description:
When an issue is created through Jira Cloud for Outlook, the Epic link will not give any suggestions that are relevant to the assigned project before the entire Epic link name is typed.
For ex: "AQ2691-9". - It gives results only for this
cannot type for example "AQ" or "2691"

Kindly have suggestions coming up when starting to type the epic name.

Also, having epics from the current project at the top would simplify the search.
fields.summary: Epic name search does not give suggestions until the name is typed in fully.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

With a recent change, the configuration option *Show entire text for summary, description, comment, and worklog* will show the full text and be verbose. This can be disabled with {{Truncated}} mode.
It's either too much information or very less with these options.

h3. Suggested Solution:

Allow a hybrid of these notifications or more control for admins to choose the format.

For example:
For transitions, just the title and the whole comment in the notification.
fields.summary: Improve Slack notification format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JQL Filter and Query are not getting saved while exiting excel in "Jira Cloud for Excel"  on Windows 10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 *Problem 1*
 # Create two sheet in Excel
 # Navigate to the second sheet
 # Use the available Jira filter from the add-on
 # Save and exit the excel
 *Problem 2*
# Open the excel add-on
# Use the JQL/Filter
# Save the file on network drive


h3. Expected Results

Jira Excel should store the Saved Filter

h3. Actual Results

The add-on shows the default value when the file is re-opened. 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JQL Filter and Query are not getting saved while exiting excel in "Jira Cloud for Excel"

fields.description:
Summary: Currently when using the Slack to Jira integration and clicking on a chat > "Add to issue", it adds the slack chat under *Slack "Open issue activity"* when reviewing the issue in Jira. 

This is not easily discoverable and it will be more user friendly if it is added as a comment to the Jira issue.
fields.summary: When using "Add to issue" on Slack, add as a comment to issue

fields.description:
Currently, when using the command /jira create on Slack, the field *Original Estimates* is not displayed even if the *Time Tracking* field is on the screen within Jira.

It would be awesome to have that field and other ones.
fields.summary: Add Original Estimates field to the slack issue creation screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Occasionally, a query fails upon refresh or a sheet that is supposed to refresh hourly does not do so for many hours. Less frequently, a query expires and it would be nice to know about these ones too.

The solution is easy on all of these, the sheet owner opens the Add-on and can then refresh manually.

The problem is the failure is silent and the data either disappears or slowly gets more stale.

h3. Suggested Solution
Request is for a way to raise the visibility of these failures, presumably via some type of monitoring or alerting strategy. This would be especially valuable for the situation where the query refresh fails.
fields.summary: Alert on Query Refresh Failure

fields.description:
Currently on Ms Teams integration with Confluence Cloud, while it is possible to see pages on MS Teams, it is not possible to see some macros, including native and 3rd party macros.

We're raising this suggestion in order to improve/add the ability to dd this functionality to see such macros as it is the case of the Draw.io macro, so the customer can see the diagram on the page in MS Teams, without having to go to the Confluence page to see it, improving the sharing content experiencing.
fields.summary: Ability to see macros on the Microsoft Teams and Confluence integration
Exporting issues using the Excel option does not respect user's permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can get transition related fields from the issues when using Jira Cloud for Sheets, including the date for the transition by using the property *Status Transition.date*.

Currently, if you use the JIRA JQL function to retrieve results, the *Status Transition.date* is returned on the wrong format (its database format).

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Access the Jira Cloud for Sheets app;
* Enable the *Jira function*;
* Perform a search as the following:
{code}
=JIRA("key= AV-6399", "key, transition.date")
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The date format of the *transition.date* column will follow the other dates.

h3. Actual Results

The format returned is the one as stored in the database:
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-30 at 14.57.53.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use the JQL method to retrieve the results instead. Currently, the transition.date format is correct when using that method:
 !Screen Shot 2021-03-30 at 16.05.50.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Transition date format is incorrect when importing issues via JIRA JQL function on Sheets

fields.description: It would be awesome if you could configure which elements to include in the Slack notification
fields.summary: Allow formatting of Slack notification

fields.description:
Currently, you can use the "Add to Issue" for channels and for DM. 
But the content will be only visible to users with access to that channel or users on that DM. 

It would be a good feature to allow a user to decide if the content should or should not be restricted when using the "Add to Issue".
fields.summary: Ability to use "Add to Issue" feature via DM to add a content visible to all users

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customers with a Premium subscription have the possiblity of using the [Allowlist|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access/] feature to control access to their products.

They can control the access via IP address, which will also impact applications that connect externally.

But, currently, our app [Jira Cloud for Outlook (Official)|https://appsource.microsoft.com/en-us/product/office/wa200000056?tab=overview] is not compatible with the Allowlist. 

When the Allowlist is activated, that app will be blocked, and there aren't any addresses that can be provided to allow the app to be able to connect to the Jira instance.

h3. Suggestion

Make the app compatible with the Allowlist.
fields.summary: Make Jira Cloud for Outlook compatible with our Allowlist

fields.description: Test: Please ignore
fields.summary: Test: Please ignore

fields.description:
Currently, our GDPR documentation for Jira server's MS Teams integration states that we have two Azure clusters in which customer data is stored:
{quote}
h1. GDPR: Where is data stored

Our cloud provider is *Microsoft Azure*. We host all static files (HTML, CSS, JavaScript files) and RESTful web services under two regions: *West Europe (Netherlands) and Central US (Iowa)*.

At the moment user cannot choose in what region to store data afore mentioned (Oauth tokens and Jira url), so all user's requests will be served by closest region to the user. 
{quote}
But this is apparently incorrect; it seems that this information is correct for the Cloud offering, but *not* for the Server offering. For Jira Server, there is only a service based in the USA.

This is problematic for at least a couple reasons:
 * Customers who cannot or do not wish to have data stored in the USA are unknowingly doing so
 * This results in high latency and slowed performance for customers in the EU, as each request has to go EU -> USA -> EU -> USA -> EU.

We should investigate possibilities for data storage closer to our EU customers to help them avoid these issues.
fields.summary: Create EU Cluster for Jira Server for MS Teams

fields.description:
Currently,  Slack allows messaging between workspaces in grids, so if we're connected to different workspaces, the banner still will be displayed:
 !slack - jira app.png|thumbnail! 

It would be awesome to be able to disable that per workspace (Don't Ask again) regardless of different workspaces in grids.
fields.summary: Disable the banner issue-unfurling-demo per workspace

fields.description:
I noticed the Jira Cloud for Excel add-in doesn't refresh the Jira data when using Excel's 'Refresh All' button;

It would be very helpful (especially for less tech-savvy people) to also refresh Jira data when refreshing all connections in Excel.
fields.summary: Refresh Jira data when using Excel's 'Refresh All' button

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The [Microsoft Teams for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217836/microsoft-teams-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview] app provides basic functionality to issue operations. 
- Search, share, create new or modify existing issues - change priority, status, update summary or description
- Perform quick actions: log time, watch, vote, add comment or assign issue to yourself

However, it is not possible to approve / deny an issue when approval is needed. User(s) will need to view the issue in Jira and then approve / deny the issue. 
 
h3. Suggested Solution
Implement approval actions in Teams.
 
h3. Workaround
No workaround is available.
fields.summary: Jira Server for Teams - Implement approval action in Teams

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description:

Currently, if you export a saved search to Google/Excel sheets the Affected Services field appears as "[no field found]" 
h3. Suggest Solution: 

Provide support for this field to appear in the search results and in the exported file
fields.summary: Support for "Affected Services" field in service management projects.

fields.description: The "create issue from" action and {{/jira create}} commands do not currently support subtasks in Jira. Some teams may benefit from being able to create subtasks on existing issues in Slack; perhaps being able to select the parent issue if they first select subtask as the issue type.
fields.summary: Create subtasks from Slack

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Cloud for Outlook (Official) add-on does not show the issues from the 2nd and 3rd instances in the *Send to issue.*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Outlook
 # Select *Create issue* button and connect to a couple of different instances
 # Create few tickets in each instance
 # Select *Send to issue* button it only shows issues from instance A not B

h3. Expected Results

To retrieve all the recent issues 
h3. Actual Results

It only retrieves issues from instance A
h3. Workaround

Type the project key from instance B to retrieve the issues from instance B
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for Outlook (Official) add-on does not show the issues from the 2nd and 3rd instances in the Send to issue.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Notification rules in [Jira Server for Slack|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220099/jira-server-for-slack-official?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview] intermittently fail to reach Slack due to an apparent race condition.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a complex notification rule, for example a rule which filters for a specific issue type, specific project, and a transition to a specific workflow status.
# Transition issues to match that filter.

h3. Expected Results
The rule executes consistently, and notifications appear in Slack every time.

h3. Actual Results
Some or all of the notifications will fail to appear in Slack.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

*Notes:*

This is occurring due to an apparent race condition, per comment by [~mvlasov@atlassian.com] on [the issue report on our public Github for this app|https://github.com/atlassian-labs/atlassian-slack-integration-server/issues/24]:
{quote}
It feels like it is a race condition issue. Currently the plugin relies on {{IssueEvent}} event, but it seems to be triggered before or after the changelog is saved to the Jira database, so the app is unable to detect changed fields sometimes. The solution here is to migrate to another event - {{IssueChangedEvent}}. It provides a way to retrieve a consistent changelog.
{quote}

Because of the intermittent nature of this bug, this issue has appeared to multiple customers to have been fixed in previous updates, but regressed in later releases.
fields.summary: Slack notification rules for issue transitions fail to send intermittently

fields.description:
Implement the option to change the language of the integration between Jira and MS Teams.

Currently, even if you change the language of Jira and Teams, commands in MS Teams for Jira plugin are still in English.
fields.summary: Ability to change the language of MS Teams for Jira integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Spreadsheets export producing incorrect dates/times
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Perform a JQL search
 # Click on the _Open in Microsoft Excel_ icon.
 !2021-03-08_15-49-39.png|thumbnail! 
 # When presented with the _Select your Excel product_ popup, click _Excel on Desktop_. This will download the file to your desktop.
 # Open the file with Microsoft Excel or MacOS Numbers

h3. Expected Results
 * The dates/time should be displayed as that on your Jira Cloud settings

h3. Actual Results
 * The dates/times are shown in UTC format

h3. Workaround
 * Determine your timezone, say UTC+11
 * In Excel, let's say cell *A2* has the time in UTC. Add a new cell with the formula:
{code:java}
=A2 + TIME(11,0,0){code}
where the *11* is the positive offset from UTC.
fields.summary: Jira Spreadsheets export producing incorrect dates/times

fields.description:
h3. Description
At this time MS Teams integration creates Jira Core/Software tickets that only have issue type configuration.

h3. Suggest resolution
Add the ability to use Jira Service Management ticket with a valid "Request Type" so the tickets can be available at the customer portal.

h3. Workaround
We can use legacy JSM automation to set the request type:
* [Automatically set Customer Request Type When Issue is Created via Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/copy-of-automatically-set-customer-request-type-when-issue-is-created-via-jira-1026039858.html]
fields.summary: Add the ability to create Jira Service Management tickets via MS teams

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an issue from Slack, if there are more than one link (Slack formatting) in one line of text, only the first will be added to Jira.

The "swallowing" only occurs when there are "mailto" links. Other links are not swallowed but still break proper formatting.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # {{Use /jira create command}}
 # Type in a description like "Foo (<mailto:example.com|some@example.com>) bar (<mailto:example.com|some@example.com>) baz."
 # Submit

h3. Expected Results

Issue description in Jira should have two links.
h3. Actual Results

Description will be:
{noformat}
Foo (some@example.com) baz.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Creating an issue from Slack with multiple links in a line swallows all but the first link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, when you paste the URL of an issue in the *Jira Cloud for MS Teams*, it creates a preview window underneath the link with some details of the ticket.

However, the same preview window does not exist in the *Jira Server for MS Teams*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect your Jira Server with MS Teams via Jira Server app for MS Teams;
 # Paste the URL of some issue from Jira Server system;
 # No preview window is created underneath the URL.

h3. Expected Results

See the same preview window as the *Jira Cloud app*.
h3. Workaround

No workaround is available.
fields.summary: Jira Server for MS Teams - Preview ticket window

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While working with the Microsoft Teams and Jira integration, the MS Teams notification shows the Status category details in the notifications instead of the actual status name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Microsoft Teams and Jira 
 # Configure the Webhook
!Webhook_Status.png|thumbnail!
 # Checking the existing Issue status and their Category
!Status_Name_And_Category.png|thumbnail!
 # Creating a new issue (Status - Backlog)
!Issue_view_Status_Backlog.png|thumbnail!
 # MS Teams notifications showing the Issue details and its status
!MS_Teams_Notification_Showing_status_Category.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The Microsoft Team Notifications show the actual name of the Issue status.
h3. Actual Results

The Microsoft Team Notifications show the Status category Instead of showing the actual name of the status.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: MS Teams notifications show Status Category instead of the actual Status Name

fields.description:
h3. Description

Currently, when we create an issue via MS Teams App, we can see all fields available - as per the fields configured in the Jira screen:
h5. Create Issue screen in MS Teams App
|!image-2021-03-02-08-56-45-028.png|width=415,height=380!|!image-2021-03-02-08-57-33-139.png|width=416,height=379!|

However, when we try to edit the issue, only the system fields are appearing:
h5. Edit Issue screen in MS Teams App
|!image-2021-03-02-09-00-07-363.png|width=420,height=280!|
h3. Expected Result

It is expected to see the same fields from the Edit Screen in Jira.
h3. Workaround

In the Edit screen on MS Teams App, click on the Issue link to edit the desired fields directly in Jira.
fields.summary: Show all fields in the "Edit Issue" screen on MS Teams

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in the SLA column when data is exported to Either [Jira Cloud for Google Sheets (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220382/jira-cloud-for-google-sheets-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] or [Jira Cloud for Excel (official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221301/jira-cloud-for-excel-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] the data is only showing the time metric, either positive if the SLA still has time left or negative if breached.  However there is no indication of the status of the SLA such as Active, Paused, Goal met, breached, original time value, etc... 

h3. Suggested Solution
Users are looking for the extended data for the SLA goals, and status to be an option as a subfield in the exported data set
 
h3. Workaround
Define various sheets using JQL to group the SLA variables and show a list of the various states in each sheet as covered in [Write JQL queries for SLAs|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/write-jql-queries-for-slas/]:
* breached()
* everBreached()
* paused()
* completed()
* running()
* withincalendarhours()
* elapsed()
* remaining()

As an example, if you wanted a report to show the differences between all completed SLA's for the "time to first response"  metrics that have breached and a list of all completed that have not breached use the following JQL on sheet 1 to show the non breached and completed SLA:
{code}
"Time to first response" = completed() AND "Time to first response" != everBreached()
{code}
And the second sheet would use the following JQL to show all completed but did not meet the metric goal:
{code}
"Time to first response" = completed() AND "Time to first response" = everBreached()
{code}
fields.summary: Support for SLA subfield data in Sheets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Exporting using Excel export. displays UTC timezone

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for issues
 # Export to Excel

h3. Expected Results
Dates to show in the timezone of the user exporting

h3. Actual Results
Dates show in UTC


h3. Workaround
Updating the dates directly in Excel 
Exporting in CSV file and converting to Excel
fields.summary: Exporting using Excel export displays UTC timezone

fields.description:
Currently for Jira Slack integration, for "Issue Transitioned event", if we select *Show entire text for summary, description, comment, and worklog*

Please refer to the attached screenshot for more clarification. *Slack Configuration.png*

- The *Expected behavior* is to retrieve Issue Descriptionalong with Summary.
- The Actual result: For the *Issue Transition* event, we can only see the summary but not the description.
- On the other hand, for *Issue Creation*, we can see both Summary and description.

This is confirmed internally that "Description isn't included in issue transition notifications", please update the UI message to avoid confusions.
fields.summary: Request to update the User Interface message for Jira-Slack Integration

fields.description:
- Currently for Jira Slack integration, if we select "Show entire text for summary, description, comment, and worklog":

The Expected behavior is to retrieve Issue Descriptionalong with Summary.
actual result: For Issue Transition event, we can only see the summary but not the description. 
*Screenshot Attached*: IssueTransitionsSlackConfiguration.png

- On the other hand, for Issue Creation, we can see both Summary and description.
fields.summary: JIRA for Slack integration: Ability to retrieve Description field being displayed on Slack notifications for Issue Transition

fields.description: As a Jira admin, I'd like to disable the connection prompt message sent by the bot to the user when the link unfurling was disabled globally.
fields.summary: Disable connection prompt message when link unfurling is disabled globally

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
connect command is not available in the list of suggested commands on Team Side

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure the *MS Team Integration in Jira*.
 # On Ms Team side tab attempt to type *connect* or clic on *What can I do*:
 # Observe that the connect command is not either retrieved or suggested:
 !Screenshot 2021-02-11 at 14.50.44.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2021-02-11 at 14.51.42.png|thumbnail! 

The behaviour is the same when using the Ms Team Webapp, Desktop app or the Mobile app.

h3. Expected Results
connect command should be suggested.
h3. Actual Results
connect command is not suggested.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: connect command is not available in the list of suggested commands on Team Side

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Slack sending multiple notifications even after installing mandatory updates even after slack admin allowing the changes in each workspace

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install updates per https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/Upgrade-the-Confluence-Cloud-Slack-integration-to-granular/ba-p/1552608
 

h3. Expected Results
Slack should not send multiple notifications 

h3. Actual Results
It is sending multiple notifications


h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Slack sending multiple upgrade notifications even after installing mandatory updates

fields.description:
While creating an issue from MS Team Side by typing create, fields tab are not available into the create screen.

Please provide the ability to show fields tabs into create issue screen from MS Team
fields.summary: Provide the ability to show fields tabs into create issue screen from MS Team

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Create issue from Ms Team does not show Insight Asset Management fields.
By default the issue create screen from MS Team side does not support custom fields coming from third party plugin. Only custom fields type bundled with Jira are shown.
However it does also not show *Atlassian Insight custom fields*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a project add an Insight custom field of any type to the create screen.
 !Screenshot 2021-02-05 at 17.09.03.png|thumbnail! 
 # In Ms Team type *create*.
 # Notice that the Insight field is not visible:
 !Screenshot 2021-02-05 at 17.08.50.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The Create screen should show Insight fields.
h3. Actual Results
The Create screen does not show Insight fields.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Create issue from Ms Team does not show Insight Asset Management fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When user export using Excel export feature, the date/time field doesn't follow the personal settings time zone , but it display with UTC timezone.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Personal Settings, change the timezone, for example, Sydney timezone.
 # Go to *Issue Navigator* page and filter the issue would like to export
# Then, click the Excel button to export it:-
 !Screen Shot 2021-02-02 at 1.14.56 pm.png|thumbnail! 
# Check the Created field

h3. Expected Results
The created date display with Sydney timezone , which is the same as display in JIRA.

h3. Actual Results
The created date time display with UTC timezone

h3. Workaround
Export using CSV format and open via Excel.
fields.summary: Exporting using Excel export doesn't follow the Personal settings time zone , but it display with UTC timezone

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

On Jira Cloud for Excel, we can select a specific project on "Show fields for" to find the desired fields to import to Excel, but after clicking on save, it reverts back to "All projects".
h3. *Suggestion*

Keep the project selected after clicking on save, because the person who is using the feature may work on a specific project, and on a site that has many projects, the person will have to select the project every time they need to get issues from Jira.
fields.summary: "Show fields for" is reset after clicking on save

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Cloud for sheets does not render image from the about tab
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export any result from the Advance search screen and open the About tab from the google sheet file

h3. Expected Results

Show the correct image with the information from the built add-on
h3. Actual Results

Shows blank space:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Cloud for sheets does not render image from the about tab

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

Many customers use third-party add-ons on their Jira environments which are not supported by the MSTeams for Jira. ScriptRunner add-on related BUG:
 (flag) API-307-_Unclear error message "An unhandled error occurred" when creating issue on MS teams and not filling a required field_

We also have BUGs with disabled options of custom fields that can be selected in the issue creation screen: 
 (flag) API-300 - _During the issue creation (on MS Teams app already integrated with JIRA using the MS Teams for JIRA Plugin) the Custom Fields (type Single Choice) display disabled options_

We have workarounds applied in Jira that don't take effect in MSTEAMS:
 (flag) API-301-_Log Work still available on MS even if we disable on Jira_
h2. Suggested Solution

We would like to use the "MS Teams for Jira" add-on just to get *Jira notifications* and to *view Dashboards* configured in the tabs.

For this purpose, we need a feature that blocks users to manage the issues on the MSTEAMS side (update/create/comment/log hours on issues).
fields.summary: As an admin, I want field level permissions to disable issue creation and updates in Jira Tickets through MS Teams app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Importing values for the field Team or Parent currently wipes out the values for the Epic link related columns.

That happens if you import the fields Team/Parent *after* you have already imported the Epic link related fields.

h3. Update

Adding the field *Rank* causes the same behaviour.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Import values in Sheets, including the column Epic link;
* Add other Epic link related columns (e.g. Epic link.ID, Epic link.Name);
* After importing those, add the column Team;
* Here's a recording:  [^Jira Cloud for Sheets - Team behaviour.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results

The columns related to Epic link (ID, Name, Status) will be kept along with the results from the field Team.

h3. Actual Results

The Epic link related columns are wiped out.

h3. Workaround

Currently, that does not happen if you open the results in Sheets when they include the field *Team* already. 
* Here's a recording showing that behaviour:  [^Open results in Sheets.mp4] 

Or, if you have an existing sheet, you can:
* Remove the Epic link related fields from the results;
* Add the Team/Parent field in the results;
* Add the Epic link related fields back:
** That will keep the values for the Epic link fields:  [^Team before Epic link.mp4]
fields.summary: Epic link related fields are wiped out after you import values for the fields Team or Parent in Google Sheets for Jira Cloud

fields.description:
As a Slack and Jira user,

I'd like to be able to filter the notifications sent by Jira to Slack through the integrations,

So that I receive notifications for comments NOT created by me.

 

Currently, there is no way to filter the comments by any parameter besides created/updated/deleted.
fields.summary: Enhance filtering in Slack/Jira

fields.description: It would be great to view and edit labels on the issue view screen.
fields.summary: Show "Labels" field and allow editing it on issue view
